alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 10:05PM MDT until July 29 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN FREMONT AND NORTHWESTERN PUEBLO COUNTIES... At 1005 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the open country south of Penrose have weakened considerably. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in an area centered around 5 miles south of Penrose. Flash flooding is expected to continue until the runoff has time to recede. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Open country south of Penrose. This includes the following streams and drainages... Willow Spring Creek, and Minnequa Canal which flow into the Arkansas River. Turkey Creek may also experience some high flows. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
